name: avw2fsl
author: GNU coreutils
description: Processing script to copy files and directories.

inputs.description: Source file(s) or directory to copy.
inputs.name: Source

inputs.description: Destination file or directory where the source is to be copied.
inputs.name: Destination

inputs.description: Archive mode; same as -dR --preserve=all.
inputs.name: Archive

inputs.description: Don't copy the file data, just the attributes.
inputs.name: Attributes only

inputs.description: Make a backup of each existing destination file.
inputs.name: Backup

inputs.description: Like --backup but does not accept an argument.
inputs.name: Backup without argument

inputs.description: Copy contents of special files when recursive.
inputs.name: Copy contents

inputs.description: Same as --no-dereference --preserve=links.
inputs.name: No dereference & preserve links

inputs.description: If an existing destination file cannot be opened, remove it and try again.
inputs.name: Force

inputs.description: Prompt before overwrite.
inputs.name: Interactive

inputs.description: Follow command-line symbolic links in SOURCE.
inputs.name: Follow command-line symbolic links

inputs.description: Hard link files instead of copying.
inputs.name: Hard link

inputs.description: Always follow symbolic links in SOURCE.
inputs.name: Dereference

inputs.description: Do not overwrite an existing file.
inputs.name: No-clobber

inputs.description: Never follow symbolic links in SOURCE.
inputs.name: No dereference

inputs.description: Preserve mode, ownership, and timestamps.
inputs.name: Preserve

inputs.description: Preserve the specified attributes (default: mode,ownership,timestamps).
inputs.name: Preserve attributes

inputs.description: Deprecated, same as --preserve=context.
inputs.name: Preserve context

inputs.description: Don't preserve the specified attributes.
inputs.name: No preserve

inputs.description: Use full source file name under DIRECTORY.
inputs.name: Parents

inputs.description: Copy directories recursively.
inputs.name: Recursive

inputs.description: Control clone/CoW copies.
inputs.name: Reflink

inputs.description: Remove each existing destination file before attempting to open it.
inputs.name: Remove destination

inputs.description: Control creation of sparse files.
inputs.name: Sparse

inputs.description: Remove any trailing slashes from each SOURCE argument.
inputs.name: Strip trailing slashes

inputs.description: Make symbolic links instead of copying.
inputs.name: Symbolic link

inputs.description: Override the usual backup suffix.
inputs.name: Suffix

inputs.description: Specify the target directory.
inputs.name: Target directory

inputs.description: Treat DEST as a normal file.
inputs.name: No target directory

inputs.description: Copy only when the SOURCE file is newer than the destination file or when the destination file is missing.
inputs.name: Update

inputs.description: Explain what is being done.
inputs.name: Verbose

inputs.description: Stay on this file system.
inputs.name: One file system

inputs.description: Set SELinux security context of destination file to default type.
inputs.name: SELinux context

inputs.description: Like -Z, or if CTX is specified set the SELinux or SMACK security context to CTX.
inputs.name: Context

inputs.description: Display this help and exit.
inputs.name: Help

inputs.description: Output version information and exit.
inputs.name: Version

output-files.description: Destination file or directory where the source is copied.
output-files.name: Output destination
